p: Thus, based on the high prevalence of Candida spp. infections in the oral cavity and the side effects related to its treatment, it has become evident the need for new alternative treatments to overcome this problem, especially for non-extensive lesions of OC, since that these new alternatives will make it possible to treat the infection without exposing the patient to the side effects of traditional therapies [ 15]. In this context, studies that evaluated the antifungal activity of natural products, such as plant extracts and natural oils, highlighted that these products are able to inhibit the growth of Candida spp. [ 5, 15], suggesting potential use of natural products in OC treatment.
